CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: External Brute Force Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Successful authentication after multiple failed attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Distributed Brute Force
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A successful brute force authentication -- multiple failed authentication attempts from different external hosts to the same host using the same origin login, followed by an authentication success.
UTD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Concurrent VPN from Multiple Locations
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login are observed from different regions within a given time period (default 3 hours).
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Account Anomaly: Concurrent VPN Mult Country
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login are observed from different countries within a given time period (default 24 hours).
Included in modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Blacklist Location Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Authentication success from a blacklisted location.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Auth After Numerous Failed Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple external unique login attempts are seen on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Auth After Dispersed Failed Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Within a short period of time, a single account unsuccessfully attempts to authenticate to multiple hosts from an external source.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Data Exfiltration Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: External attack or compromise followed by data leaving the same system. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 13.6

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: External Attack then Acct Creation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an external source followed by an account creation on the same host.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Attack then External Connection
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An observed external attack or compromise followed by data leaving the system and going to the attacker. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.3

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Log Cleared
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A compromise event from an external source followed by the audit log being cleared on the same compromised host.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Critical Event After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An external attack or compromise followed by a critical event on the same host.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Security Event then Process Start
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Security Classification of Compromise, Reconnaissance, Attack event against a host followed by a non-whitelisted process starting up on the same host, indicating a compromise.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Recon then Account Creation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Reconnaissance from an external source followed by account creation on the same host.
Modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Attack then New Process Starting
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An attack or compromise event followed by a non-whitelisted process starting up on the same host, indicating a possible compromise.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Data Destruction
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack event followed by a FIM delete/modify event on the same host.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Auth After Security Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An observed attack, compromise, or other security event followed by successful access or authentication from the attacking host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Privilege Escalation after Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Compromised host event followed by a new account created or account modified on the same host.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Audit Disabled by Admin
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Login by an administrator followed by disabling of an audit process. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 6.2, CSC 5.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Temporary Account Used
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An account is created, logged into, and then deleted within 1 day. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 5.4

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Account Anomaly: Concurrent VPN Multiple City
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login are observed from different cities within a given time period (default 30 minutes).
Included in modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Local Account Created and Used
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An account is created on a host and then used shortly thereafter on the same host. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 5.4

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Brute Force Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple failed authentication attempts from the same internal origin host to the same impacted host, followed by an authentication success from the same origin host to the same impacted host.
User Analytics - UTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Distributed Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Successful brute force authentication from an internal source -- ie several internal hosts using the same account to first fail multiple times to authenticate before successfully logging in.s:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Failed Auths then Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple internal unique login attempts are seen on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Internal Attack then Acct Creation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by an account creation on the victim host.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Data Delete
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by a FIM delete/modify event on the victim host.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Log Cleared
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by the audit log being cleared on the victim host.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Recon then Process Start
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal reconnaissance event followed by a process starting up on the victim host.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Lateral Movement then Exfil
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by data leaving the victim host. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 13.6

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Process
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by a non-whitelisted process starting up on the victim host.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Ext Conn
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by data leaving the system and going to the attacker.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Brute Force then Exfil
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal brute force attack followed by a Data Loss Defender event.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Critical
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by a critical event on the victim host.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement then Escalation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by a new account created or account modified on the victim host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by a successful access or authentication on the victim host.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Malware Outbreak
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple observed malware detections or failed malware detections within a given period on different impacted hosts - grouped by Common Event and Threat Name.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Early Attack Cycle
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A full attack cycle -- scanning followed by an attack and account creation.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Malicious Payload Drop
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An attack or compromise event followed by a download of a potentially malicious payload on the host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Config Change then Critical Error
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration change followed by a critical error on the same host indicating an erroneous configuration, malicious intent or otherwise. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 3.6

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Internal Recon then Account Creation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal reconnaissance event followed by an account creation on the same target host, indicating a possible compromise.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Disabled Account Auth Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Recently disabled or deleted account authenticates or accesses resources on the network. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 16.8

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: System Time Change
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An attack or compromise events followed by time change activity on the same impacted host.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Malware: DNSChanger IP Ranges
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: DNS communications to/from the known malicious IP ranges associated with the DNSChanger malware.

CommonEvent.Name: Account Compromised
Host Compromised
Data Compromised
Network Compromised
Facility Compromised
AIE: Disruption: Files Deleted by Admin
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Privileged user login followed by multiple file deletions, indicating the administrator may be destroying large amounts of data.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Compromise Alert Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any identified compromise event in supplemental support of PCI-DSS Controls: 11.4.a-c, 12.10.5

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP : Compromise Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on compromise activity within the organization infrastructure.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Corroborated Account Anomalies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: 3 or more unique behavioral anomalies for a given user within a 3 hour period.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Corroborated Anomalies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: 3 or more unique behavioral anomalies for a given host within a 3-hour period.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Corroborated Data Access Anomalie
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: 2 or more unique behavioral anomalies for data within a 3 hour period.s
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53 : Compromise Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on compromises.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Host Comp + Acct Created
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by an account being created on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Host Comp + Audit Log Clear
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by the audit log being cleared on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Host Comp + Crit Data Destru
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by critical files being deleted on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Brute Force Dist Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Brute Force Sngl Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl Count
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different countries within a given time period (default 1 day).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl Reg
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different regions within a given time period (default 1 2 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl City
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different cities within a given time period (default 6 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Concur VPN Auth Same User
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN logins from the same user but from different origin hosts within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Acct Probe On Multiple Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of the same account attempting to externally authenticate to multiple hosts, unsuccessfully, within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Acct Probe On Single Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple external login attempts on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Host Compromise + Time Change
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised, followed by time change activity on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Host Comp + Acct Created
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by an account being created on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Host Comp + Audit Log Clear
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by the audit log being cleared on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53 : Internal : Spamming System Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on non-mail servers sending mail out to multiple unique external SMTP servers within a very short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Account Probe On Mltpl Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of an account being used to attempt to internally authenticate to multiple hosts, unsuccessfully, within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Account Probe On Single Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple internal unique login attempts on the same impacted host followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Brute Force Sngl Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides multiple failed authentication attempts from the same origin host to the same impacted host, followed by an authentication success from the same origin host to the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Brute Force Dist Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different internal origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Host Comp + Crit Data Dest
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by critical files being deleted on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Malware Activity Mltpl Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple observed malware detections within a given period of time (default 30 minutes) from different impacted hosts.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13 : Compromise Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This report directly supports GPG-13 controls PMC5.2, PMC5.4, and PMC5.8 by providing details of all compromise activity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Large Outbound Transfer
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Single host is seen sending over 1GB of data within 30 minutes out of the network. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.10, CSC 13.6

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Config Deleted/Disabled
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration deleted within the organization infrastructure. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 3.5, CSC 11.3

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Config Modified
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration modified within the organization infrastructure. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 3.5, CSC 11.3

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Config Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack event on a host followed by a configuration change made to that host within 3 minutes. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 11.3, CSC 3.6

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Blacklisted Egress Port Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Triggered when an internal host communicates with a host outside the network using a port not on the allowed list. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 9.2, CSC 12.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Mult Pass Modified by Separate User
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple occurrences of one user changing another's password. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 16.14, CSC 5.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: RCC: POS New Process
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This rule will watch a "Gold Standard" POS system for process activity and build a whitelist profile of processes running on the "Gold Standard," comparing all other POS endpoints with the "Gold Standard" process list. RCC

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: RCC: Back Office New Process
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This rule will watch a "Gold Standard" back-office payment system for process activity and build a whitelist profile of processes running on the "Gold Standard," comparing all other "like" systems with the "Gold Standard" process list. RCC

CommonEvent.Name: Honeypot Activity
AIE: Honeypot: Logon Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Observed successful attacks on a honeypot login form.
Modules: Honeypot

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Honeypot: Host Compromise
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Observed successful attacks on a honeypot, resulting in gaining 'access' to the false system.
Modules: Honeypot

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Honeypot: Interaction
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Observed interaction in relation to high-interaction honeypots. This will help to capture and display pertinent activity related to hacking activity and further attempted exploitation of the server within the SIEM dashboard.
Modules: Honeypot

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Compromise Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on compromises.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Host Comp + Acct Created
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by an account being created on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Host Comp + Audit Log Clear
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by the audit log being cleared on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Host Comp + Crit Data Destru
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by critical files being deleted on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Brute Force Sngl Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl Count
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different countries within a given time period (default 1 day).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl Reg
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different regions within a given time period (default 1 2 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Conc Remote Auth Mltpl City
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different cities within a given time period (default 6 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Concur VPN Auth Same User
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN logins from the same user but from different origin hosts within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Acct Probe On Multiple Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of the same account attempting to externally authenticate to multiple hosts, unsuccessfully, within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Acct Probe On Single Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple external login attempts on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Host Compromise + Time Change
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised, followed by time change activity on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Host Comp + Acct Created
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by an account being created on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Host Comp + Audit Log Clear
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by the audit log being cleared on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Intrnl Spam
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on non-mail servers sending mail out to multiple unique external SMTP servers within a very short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Account Probe On Mltpl Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of an account being used to attempt to internally authenticate to multiple hosts, unsuccessfully, within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF:Int: Succ Accnt Probe On Single Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple internal unique login attempts on the same impacted host followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Brute Force Dist Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different internal origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Brute Force Sngl Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides multiple failed authentication attempts from the same origin host to the same impacted host, followed by an authentication success from the same origin host to the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Host Comp + Crit Data Dest
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on a host being potentially compromised followed by critical files being deleted on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Malware Activity Mltpl Hosts
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple observed malware detections within a given period of time (default 30 minutes) from different impacted hosts.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Brute Force Dist Origin Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details of multiple failed authentication attempts from different internal origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Security Event then Windows Firew
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Security event followed by a change to a host's Windows Firewall.
Endpoint Analytics - ETA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Security Event then Software Inst
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Security event followed by an application installation on the same host.
Endpoint Analytics - ETA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Security Event then Scheduled Tas
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A security event on a host followed by creation of a scheduled process.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Pass the Hash
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A user has successfully gained access to another system within the domain by way of passing locally cached credentials to another system. This attack works when local accounts have not been adequately disabled.
Endpoint Analytics - ETA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: PowerShell PSExec
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An attacker attempting to use the Metasploit PSExec module on a compromised host to gain remote access to a host using stolen credentials.
Endpoint Analytics - ETA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Data Exfiltration
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: External attack or compromise followed by data leaving the same system.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Corruption: Audit Disabled by Admin
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Login by an administrator followed by disabling of an audit process.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Locally Created and Used
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An account is created on a host and then used shortly thereafter on the same host.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Exfil: Lateral Movement then Exfil
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by data leaving the victim host.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: System Time Change After Compromis
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event every time an attack occurs within the environment, followed by a time change.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Data Exfiltration Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event anytime an external attack or compromise occurs within the environment, followed by data leaving the same system.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Attack then External Connection Ru
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on an observed external attack or compromise followed by data leaving the system and going to the attacker.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Concr Remote Auth Country
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different countries within a given time period (default 1 day).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Concr Remote Auth Mltpl City
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different cities within a given time period (default 6 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Concr Remote Auth Mltpl Region
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different regions within a given time period (default 1 2 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Concur VPN Auth Same User
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN logins from the same user but from different origin hosts within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Security-->Windows Firewall Change
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts when a security event is followed by a change to a host's Windows Firewall.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Software Status Change After Attac
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts when a security event is followed by an application installation on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Data Destruction Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event anytime an external attack or compromise occurs within the environment, followed by a FIM delete or modify event on the same host. Note that critical files must be monitored by LogRythm's FIM.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Concur VPN Same User
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN logins from the same user but from different origin hosts within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Concur VPN From Multiple Cities
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different cities within a given time period (default 6 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Concur VPN From Multiple Country
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different countries within a given time period (default 1 day).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Concur VPN From Multiple Region
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login from different regions within a given time period (default 12 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Compromise Detected Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts on potential compromises across the environment.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Data Destruction Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts when a compromise or attack occurs, followed by file integrity monitoring activities on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Data Exfiltration Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event anytime an external attack or compromise occurs within the environment, followed by data leaving the same system.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Software Status Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts when a security event is followed by an application installation on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: System Time Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event every time an attack occurs within the environment, followed by a time change.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Host Anomaly: CMD Set As Debugger
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: cmd.exe has been set as a debugger for the sethc.exe or utilman process.
ETD

AIE: FFD: Suspicious Account Activity (Threshold)

CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts when a compromise or attack occurs, followed by file integrity monitoring activities on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: HSS: TST Logon Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates a common event any time a logon success occurs on systems or servers assigned to the Test Systems (entity structure). This rule assists with change management testing procedures.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Target Attainment
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Target Attainment with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Exfil, Corruption, Disruption
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Exfiltration, Corruption, Disruption with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Target Attainment
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Target Attainment with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Exfil, Corruption, Disruption
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Exfiltration, Corruption, Disruption with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Target Attainment
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Target Attainment with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Exfil, Corruption, Disruption
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Exfiltration, Corruption, Disruption with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: MAS: Data Exfiltration Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event anytime an external attack or compromise occurs within the environment, followed by data leaving the same system.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: MAS: Data Destruction Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts when a compromise or attack occurs, followed by file integrity monitoring activities on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Compromise Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any identified compromise event.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Disruption: Network Device Config Wiped
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A device on a predefined list of Network Devices has had its configuration deleted or disabled. This could indicate a compromised device.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Data Exfiltration Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: External attack or compromise followed by data leaving the same system.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Disabled Account Auth Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Recently disabled or deleted account authenticates or accesses resources on the network.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Large Outbound Transfer
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Single host is seen sending over 1GB of data within 30 minutes out of the network.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Local Account Created and Used
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An account is created on a host and then used shortly thereafter on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: External Brute Force Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Successful authentication after multiple failed attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Auth After Numerous Failed Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple external unique login attempts are seen on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Auth After Security Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An observed attack, compromise, or other security event followed by successful access or authentication from the attacking host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Corroborated Data Access Anomalies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: 2 or more unique behavioral anomalies for data within a 3 hour periods. The alarm requires rule IDs 300-302 be turned on in order for this alarm to trigger.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Data Destruction
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack event followed by a FIM delete/modify event on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Distributed Brute Force
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A successful brute force authentication -- multiple failed authentication attempts from different external hosts to the same host using the same origin login, followed by an authentication success.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Blacklist Location Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Authentication success from a blacklisted location.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Concurrent VPN from Multiple Locations
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login are observed from different regions within a given time period (default 3 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Critical Event After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An external attack or compromise followed by a critical event on the same host.
Action: This alarm can identify when an error message is generated as the result of a successful attack. This can be unexpected process termination or a hardware fail

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Corroborated Account Anomalies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: 3 or more unique behavioral anomalies for a given user within a 3 hour period. This rule requires Rule IDs 285 - 289 be turned turned on.
Use Case : An account has been compromised.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Attack then External Connection
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An observed external attack or compromise followed by data leaving the system and going to the attacker.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Config Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack event on a host followed by a configuration change made to that host within 3 minutes.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Config Change then Critical Error
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration change followed by a critical error on the same host indicating an erroneous configuration, malicious intent or otherwise.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Config Deleted/Disabled
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration deleted or disabled within the organization infrastructure.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Config Modified
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Configuration modified within the organization infrastructure.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Corroborated Account Anomalies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: 3 or more unique behavioral anomalies for a given user within a 3-hour period.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Blacklist Location Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Authentication success from a blacklisted location.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Concurrent VPN from Multiple Locations
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple VPN authentication successes from the same origin login are observed from different regions within a given time (default 3 hours).

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Auth After Numerous Failed Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple external unique login attempts are seen on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Auth After Security Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An observed attack, compromise, or other security event followed by successful access or authentication from the attacking host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Distributed Brute Force
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A successful brute force authentication -- multiple failed authentication attempts from different external hosts to the same host using the same origin login, followed by an authentication success.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Corruption: Audit Disabled by Admin
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Login by an administrator followed by disabling of an audit process.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Disruption: Files Deleted by Admin
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Privileged user login followed by multiple file deletions, indicating the administrator may be destroying large amounts of data.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Auth After Dispersed Failed Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Within a short period of time, a single account unsuccessfully attempts to authenticate to multiple hosts from an external source.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: External Attack then Account Creatio
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack or compromise event from an external source followed by an account creation on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Failed Auths then Success
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple internal unique login attempts are seen on the same impacted host within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Internal Attack then Account Creatio
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack or compromise event from an internal host followed by an account creation on the victim host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Internal Recon then Account Creation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Internal reconnaissance event followed by an account creation on the same target host, indicating a possible compromise.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Privilege Escalation after Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Compromised host event followed by a new account created or account modified on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Target Attainment
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Target Attainment with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Exfil, Corruption, Disruption
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Exfiltration, Corruption, Disruption with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Target Attainment
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Target Attainment with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Exfil, Corruption, Disruption
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as any earlier stage is followed by Exfiltration, Corruption, Disruption with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Log Cleared
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A compromise event from an external source followed by the audit log being cleared on the same compromised host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Security Event then Process Start
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Security Classification of Compromise, Reconnaissance, Attack event against a host followed by a non-whitelisted process starting up on the same host, indicating a compromise.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: System Time Change
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An attack or compromise events followed by time change activity on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A security event on a host followed by creation of a scheduled process.

AIE: An account is created on a host and then used shortly thereafter on the same host.

CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: CloudAI anomalous authentication location activity observation and AI Engine observed authentication events involving location for the same user identity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: CloudAI and Location Watch List
